title: Responsive User Interaction
description: The system must be responsive to users and never bogged down with work that interferes with user interaction.
rules: Implement proper prioritization of user-facing tasks over background processes
Use background processing for non-critical work
Ensure UI remains responsive during processing (maximum 200ms response time)
Implement proper resource allocation to prevent UI blocking
Use asynchronous patterns where appropriate to maintain responsiveness
Implement progress indicators for long-running operations
Use proper threading and concurrency models
enforcementMechanisms: Performance monitoring and response time tracking
examples: Implementing background workers for data processing
Using web workers to prevent UI thread blocking
Implementing proper loading indicators for async operations
Using priority queues for user interaction handling
Implementing responsive design patterns for complex UIs
exceptions: Critical system operations that require immediate attention
Real-time processing requirements that override normal prioritization
